title: [Large-Scale] Virtual Reality-Based Cell Division Inquiry Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Middle school-level biology fundamentals (cell structure, basic genetics concepts)
context.additional_context: Re-education course in life sciences for working professionals, offering immersive learning environments via VR equipment and digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the key stages of cell division (chromosome replication, nuclear division, cytokinesis) in a 3D virtual environment.
Learners can diagnose causes of abnormal cell division cases (non-disjunction, nondisjunction) with 80% accuracy by analyzing VR simulation data.
Learners can apply cell division principles to solve real-life biotechnology problems (e.g., anticancer drug development cases) presented in a PBL format.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
